data.title: The Terminator RPG scenarios
data.meta_description: This is a list of each of the current scenarios published for the The Terminator RPG and where to find them. data.text:
This is a list of each of the current scenarios published for the The Terminator RPG and where to find them. There is also a note detailing which timeframe the scenario is set in, either Post-Judgment Day or Pre-Judgment Day, often the 80s but it could be set at various timeframes. The likely starting point is a group of resistance fighters sent to the past to complete a mission, facing off against the forces of Skynet.

Core Rulebook[]

Main article: The Terminator RPG

The Phone Book Killer by Richard August (pg 208) - A scenario inspired by the Film: The Terminator. (Pre-Judgment Day)

The Killer In Me by Jude Reid (pg 219) - A scenario inspired by the Graphic Novel: The Enemy Within. (Post-Judgment Day)

Quickstart[]

Main article: The Terminator RPG Quickstart

Two Steps Back by Richard August (pg 32) - A scenario inspired by the Graphic Novel: Tempest. (Post-Judgment Day)

Quickstart Part II[]

Main article: The Terminator RPG Quickstart Part II

One Step Forward by Richard August (pg 06) - A scenario inspired by the Graphic Novel: Tempest. (Pre-Judgment Day)

Campaign Book[]

Main article: The Terminator RPG Campaign Book

Hot Potato by Mark Rapson (pg 04) - A scenario inspired by the Graphic Novella: Suicide Run. (Post-Judgment Day)

Arms Race by Richard August (pg 08) - A scenario inspired by the Graphic Novel: Hunters and Killers. (Post-Judgment Day)

Kill/Switch by Paul Baldowski (pg 16) - A scenario inspired by the Graphic Novel: Enemy of my Enemy. (Post-Judgment Day)

Future Tense by Richard August (pg 28) - A scenario inspired by the Graphic Novel: The Terminator: 2029. (Post-Judgment Day)

The Devil’s Night Murders by Matt John (pg 36) - An original concept scenario. (Pre-Judgment Day)

Bad Block by Jon Hodgson (pg 44) - A scenario inspired by the Graphic Novel: Sector War. (Pre-Judgment Day)

Flatline by Jason Durall (pg 54) - A scenario inspired by the Graphic Novel: The Dark Years. (Pre-Judgment Day)

Skynet Bytes Forward by Benn Graybeaton (pg 62) - An original concept scenario. (Pre-Judgment Day)

The Centurion by Mark Rapson (pg 72) - An original concept scenario. (Pre-Judgment Day)

Past Tense by Richard August (pg 82) - A scenario inspired by the Graphic Novel: The Terminator: 1984. (Pre-Judgment Day)

Death in the Valley by Jared Earle (pg 88) - A scenario inspired by the Graphic Novel: Death Valley. (Pre-Judgment Day)

Tertiary Objectives by Matt John (pg 92) - A scenario inspired by the Graphic Novel: Secondary Objectives. (Pre-Judgment Day)

Fool’s Mate by Andrew E.C. Gaska & E.L. Thomas (pg 100) - A scenario inspired by the Graphic Novel: Endgame. (Pre-Judgment Day)

Past Planning by Mark Rapson (pg 106) - An original concept scenario. (Pre-Judgment Day)

Epilogue: Tense Past by Richard August (pg 120) - A scenario inspired by the Graphic Novel: The Terminator: 1984. (Pre-Judgment Day)

The T2 RPG Sourcebook[]

Main article: The T2 RPG Sourcebook

Into the Valley of Metal by Andrew E.C. Gaska & E.L. Thomas (pg 187) - An original concept scenario. (Pre-Judgment Day)

Assault on Thunder Mountain by Richard August with Andrew E.C. Gaska & E.L. Thomas (pg 198) - A scenario inspired by the Graphic Novel: The Burning Earth (Post-Judgment Day)

Terminator 2: Judgment Day by Richard August (pg 210) - A scenario inspired by the Film: Terminator 2: Judgment Day (film) (Pre-Judgment Day)

Tech-Com: Mission Reports[]

Main article: Tech-Com: Mission Reports

001: In The Pale Moonlight by Andrew E.C. Gaska and E.L. Thomas - An original concept scenario. (Post-Judgment Day)

002: Rush Hour Express by Andrew E.C. Gaska and E.L. Thomas - An original concept scenario. (Post-Judgment Day)

Fan-Made Scenarios[]

Apocalypse Then by Craig Atkins - A scenario inspired by the film Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines. (Pre-Judgment Day)
